summary: The concept of "budgetary specification" within the EU legal and regulatory framework refers to the detailed delineation of budgetary allocations and expenditures as mandated by public finance and budget policy. It encompasses the precise categorization of financial resources, ensuring transparency and accountability in the management of the EU budget. Budgetary specifications are crucial for compliance with the principles of sound financial management and facilitate effective oversight by EU institutions. This concept is integral to the formulation and execution of the EU budget, guiding member states in aligning their national budgets with EU financial regulations and objectives.
